intro: Gardenia manganjae, commonly known as the Manganja gardenia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and produces fragrant, white flowers with yellow stamens. The plant is part of the Rubiaceae family and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Gardenia manganjae is also valued for its use in traditional medicine in some regions.
